quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: North America and Cinderella
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, field, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Referring to a well-known fairy tale, the millers daughter had to spin what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dry stalks of wheat.

questions.question: The native American tribe, known as Hopi, called themselves Hopituh Shi-nu-mu. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peaceful People

questions.question: What is NOT one of Strong Bads favorite bands in the Internet cartoon Homestar Runner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sloshy

questions.question: The Iroquois nation of North America call themselves Haudenosaunee. What does this literally mean?

options.text: They Are Looking at the Moon
They Are Building a Long House

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They Are Building a Long House

questions.question: Why does Cinderella wear a glass slipper?

options.text: Glass shoes sound like something a princess would wear.
They were a symbol of her purity.
Glass shoes were worn by royalty.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glass shoes sound like something a princess would wear.

questions.question: The Nipmuc tribe is native to this U.S. state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Massachusetts

questions.question: Sitting Bull, Crazy Horse, Red Cloud, Black Elk and Billy Mills were from this Narive American tribe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lakota

questions.question: The Little Mermaid refused to kill the prince, so she eventually ends up as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A daughter of the air.

questions.question: The Mohave indigenous nation of North America called themselves Aha macave. What does this mean in English?

options.text: People who live along the river

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: People who live along the river

questions.question: Speaking of the famous fairy tale, that girl with the long hair was named which of these plants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rampion

questions.question: How did the Wyandot peoples of North America mainly provide food for themselves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By growing crops

questions.question: Only one of the following descriptions of the features of Snow White is true.  Can you spot it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wooden hair.

questions.question: Sleeping Beauty pricked her finger on the part of a spinning wheel that does this.

options.text: Twists the fibres into a thread

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twists the fibres into a thread

questions.question: What is the name of the oldest field sport in North America, which is practiced by the Choctaw Native American people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Choctaw stickball

questions.question: Which U.S. state did the Seminole nation originally populate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ron and Harry Potter
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, charm, face. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is Rons idol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Viktor Krum

questions.question: Which charm did Doby the House Elf use to get Harry Potter in huge trouble with his Uncle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A hover charm

questions.question: What is the full name of Harry Potters Headmaster, as revealed in the 5th book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore

questions.question: Who does Ron take to the Yule ball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Padma Patil

questions.question: Has Ron ever been dead?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the first task of the Triwizard Tournament (Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire ), each champion has to fight a different breed of dragon.  Which dragon does Fleur Delacour face?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Welsh Green

questions.question: Referring to the popular fairy tale, what is the name of the goose girls enchanted horse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Falada - to speak

questions.question: The witch in Hansel and Gretel was probably raised in this part of the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eastern Europe

questions.question: In which of the first six books does Ron face Voldemort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Never

questions.question: What does Ron hate the most about himself?

options.text: Being the youngest boy in his family

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being poor

questions.question: Poor Eliza of the famous fairy tale, had to make eleven shirts of what plant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Urticaceae

questions.question: What is Rons full name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Bilius Weasley

questions.question: How many siblings does Ron have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: Aside from a bit of the person you wish to become, what are the other ingredients used to make Polyjuice Potion, as seen in the 2nd book of Harry Potter?

options.text: Lacewing flies, leeches, powdered bicorn horn, knotgrass, fluxweed, and boomslang skin
Porcupine quills, leeches, lacewing flies, valerian roots, and boomslang skin
Powdered dragon horn, moonstone, lacewing flies, boomslang skin, dried nettles, and valerian roots
Moonstone, lacewing flies, boomslang skin, dried nettles, knotgrass, and bubotuber pus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lacewing flies, leeches, powdered bicorn horn, knotgrass, fluxweed, and boomslang skin

questions.question: Rons mom is part of the order of the phoenix.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Harry and Harry Potter
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, dudleys, books. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Harry Potter books, Fred and George invented a lot of products for their store, Weasleys Wizard Wheezes.  Which of the following products was not one invited by Fred and George?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coughing Cakes

questions.question: Dudleys gang consisted of Piers, dennis, Malcolm and Gordon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Hermoine broke her wrist when she fell off a broom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the name of the Muggle school Harry was to attend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stonewall High

questions.question: At Harry Potters trial during the 5th book, Madam Bones refers to Harrys patronus a corporal patronus.  What makes Harrys patronus corporal?

options.text: His patronus is strong enough to complete its intended task
His patronus is consistent enough to always have a defined shape to it
His patronus is so dependable that it becomes the same animal everytime
His patronus is so well developed it has a commanding presence whenever it is conjured

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His patronus is consistent enough to always have a defined shape to it

questions.question: Who breaks Harry Potters nose in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, the sixth novel in the series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draco Malfoy

questions.question: Harry Potters Dudley Dursley has had many traumatic encounters with wizards.  Which of the following has not happened to him?

options.text: He breaks out in horrible zits
His tongue is enlarged to almost 4 feet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He breaks out in horrible zits

questions.question: Does Draco Malfoy attempt to kill Dumbledore in the book Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who was the last person Harry talked to in the book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hermoine

questions.question: What type of candy did Dumbledore offer McGonagell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lemon Drop

questions.question: Who is the poltergeist that lives at Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peeves

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Hermione is given a time turner so she is able to make it to all of her extra classes.  Which of the following classes does she not take?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alchemy

questions.question: Where did Harry buy his wand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ollivanders

questions.question: What did the Dursleys send Harry for Christmas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A fifty pence piece

questions.question: Rons sisters name is?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginny

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Harry Potter and Book
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You can see this animal around ant-hill. It is almost 6 feet long and it likes to eat ants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anteater

questions.question: Which of the following events is associated with Independence Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Declaration of Independence

questions.question: This is a repulsive insect either black or brown. It can live a couple of weeks with its head cut off.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cockroach

questions.question: It is a big animal with brown fur and it likes eating fish and honey. It has 42 teeth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bear

questions.question: What year did Columbus first arrive on American land?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1498

questions.question: Colonial people spend some of their free time doing which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reading McGuffey

questions.question: Initially Harry Potter and Ron did not like Hermione and considered her annoying, interfering and snobby.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who does Harry Potter kiss in the book Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, after Gryffindor wins the Quidditch Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginny Weasley

questions.question: Which of the following items cannot be found in a colonial classroom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crayon

questions.question: From age 12 to 21, American activist and politician Benjamin Franklin did what?

options.text: Worked on many inventions, including electricity

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worked as an apprentice

questions.question: In 1889, this person founded the Hull House, one of the first settlement houses in the U.S.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Addams

questions.question: In which book of the Harry Potter series, Harry, Ron and Hermione start attending the Divination class, taught by Professor Trelawney?

options.text: Harry potter and the Order of the Phoniex
Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

questions.question: Which of the following is a famous quote by John Paul Jones, the well-known American naval hero from the American Revolutionary War?

options.text: Give me liberty or give me death.
I have not yet begun to fight.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I have not yet begun to fight.

questions.question: This fictional character suggests the name Dumbledores Army for the organization started by Harry, Hermione, and Ron in the book Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginny Weasly

questions.question: In what year did J.K. Rowling receive an OBE (Order of the British Empire) from the Queen of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2000

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Animal and Animals
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, ears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is a fluffy dog. It has a black-black or purple tongue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chow Chow

questions.question: This animal lives in Africa. It has a really long neck and eats leaves. It produces almost no sounds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giraffe

questions.question: Who shot gum up Peeves left nostril?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Professor Lupin

questions.question: Who is Tonks in love with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lupin

questions.question: Who wrote A History of Magic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bathilda Bagshot

questions.question: How many people where at the dinner table before Professor Trelawney joined them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: Which pairing is not correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James - Antlers

questions.question: What is the Minister of Magics name in book six?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scrimgeour

questions.question: These animals are long and slim. They creep. Most of them can go an entire year without eating at all!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snakes

questions.question: This animal is similar to a mouse but it is bigger. It can give birth to more than 160 babies in a year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rat

questions.question: When this animal wants to defend itself, it throws a nasty smell toward its aggressor. This smell can be detected by a human a mile away.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skunk

questions.question: Which subject was Hermione not taking at 9am?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potions

questions.question: Peter Pettigrew has his nose put in a box.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This is a big and grey animal with wide ears and a trunk. It cannot hop.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elephant

questions.question: These animals live in the sea. They are very friendly to humans. Although they resemble fish, they will drown if kept underwater for too long.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolphins

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Harry Potter
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, snakes, witchcraft. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which character of the Harry Potter series of books opens the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginny Weasley

questions.question: In the book Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, Harry and Ron take a ride with the flying Ford Anglia and crash into what kind of tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a whomping willow tree

questions.question: Tom Riddle worked for Florrish and Blott after he left Hogwarts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, the second book in the Harry Potter series, was published in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1998

questions.question: The fictional Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry is geographically located in which part of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scotland

questions.question: Who is the author of the Harry Potter series of books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J.K. Rowling

questions.question: This fictional character, introduced in the book Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, was teacher of the class called Defense Against the Dark Artsand five-time winner of Witch Weeklys Most Charming Smile Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilderoy Lockhart

questions.question: Who was not at Hermiones table in Herbology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neville

questions.question: In the book Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, during the summer break Harry gets a visit from a character named Dobby. What kind of creature is Dobby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a house elf

questions.question: This fictional character from the book Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets is a ghost ,who haunts the second floor girls lavatory at Hogwarts School for Witchcraft and Wizardry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moaning Myrtle

questions.question: This was the password to the Griffindore Tower after Christmas break.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: abstinence

questions.question: Which potion did Harry make to win a bottle of Liquid Luckin Chapter 9?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draught of Living Death

questions.question: Who has the hots for Harry in the first half of the book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romilda

questions.question: What is the language of snakes, spoken by some of the characters in the Harry Potter books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: parseltongue

questions.question: She is Tom Riddles mother.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merope
